object.name: SKYMED 1 Satellite details 2007-023A NORAD 31598
object.information: COSMO-SKYMED 1, which carries a radar imager, will be part of a constellation of four orbiting probes that will collect data on floods, droughts, earthquakes and landslides. It is the first to be launched, and a second was expected to lift off from Vandenberg later this year (2007). Italian space officials expect the fully functional system to beam back up to 1,800 images of the Earth a day.
